byline.contributor: Alan Blinder and John Eligon contributed reporting from Baltimore, and Erik Eckholm from New York.
byline.original: By SHERYL GAY STOLBERG and JESS BIDGOOD

abstract: Trial of Baltimore Police Officer William G Porter in death of black man Freddie Gray ends in hung jury, unexpected outcome that casts uncertainty on scheduled trials of five other officers; result, coming against backdrop of Black Lives Matter movement, is unsatisfying to many.
lead_paragraph: The trial was seen as a barometer of whether it was possible to convict a police officer, but does not end the tension in Baltimore surrounding Mr. Gray’s death.

headline.main: Mistrial Declared in Case of Officer Charged in Freddie Gray’s Death
headline.print_headline: Mistrial Is Declared in Trial of Baltimore Officer

snippet: The trial was seen as a barometer of whether it was possible to convict a police officer, but does not end the tension in Baltimore surrounding Mr. Gray’s death.
